summary: This is an email from the U.S. Department of Justice's voicemail system forwarding a voice message to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York's Epstein victims contact address. The email contains an attached audio file (.wav) of the voice message.

events.title: Voice Message Forwarded to Epstein Victims Contact
events.description: A voice message was forwarded via email from the DOJ's voicemail system to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York's designated email address for Epstein victims.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York maintained a specific email address (USANYS.EpsteinVictims@usa.doj.gov) for communication related to Epstein victims.
The DOJ used a voicemail-to-email system (voip.usa.doj.gov) to forward voice messages as email attachments.
This document shows official channels of communication were established for victims to contact prosecutors following Epstein's arrest.
The voice message content itself is not provided in the text, only the metadata about its delivery.
The email was sent on August 12, 2019, which was shortly after Epstein's arrest on July 6, 2019, and before his death on August 10, 2019.
